benchmark_details.name: SHADE-Arena: Evaluating Sabotage and Monitoring in LLM Agents
benchmark_details.overview: SHADE-Arena is a diverse agent evaluation dataset for assessing the sabotage and monitoring capabilities of LLM agents through complex pairs of benign main tasks and harmful side objectives in complicated environments.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the sabotage capabilities of large language models (LLMs) and their monitoring abilities in high-stakes environments.

data.source: Synthetic environments generated to mimic real-world agent interactions.
data.annotation: Manual engineering and transcript review to ensure task complexity and validation.

methodology.calculation: Success is defined as the agent completing the main task and side task without detection by the monitor.
methodology.interpretation: A higher score indicates better ability of agents to execute tasks without being detected.
methodology.baseline_results: Claude 3.7 Sonnet and Gemini 2.5 Pro scored 27% and 15% as sabotage agents respectively.
methodology.validation: Successful trajectories are compared across multiple models to assess performance.
